newsitem.title: USA: Halter Marine ties backlog to growth cycle.
newsitem.headline: Halter Marine ties backlog to growth cycle.

text.p: Halter Marine Group Inc, a builder of mobile offshore drilling units, said Thursday its record level of order backlog of $478 million as of March 31 bodes well for the company's growth.

"We believe that the increase in backlog of commercial work reflects the early stages of a growth cycle for many of he company's commercial products," said John Dane III, chairman president and chief executive officer.
The company, which was spun off from Trinity Industries Inc in September, said the backlog represents a "significant increase" in commericial orders over the year-ago level, but did not cite figures.

For the fourth quarter ended March 31, the company said its net income rose 74 percent to $4.7 million or $0.25 a share on revenue of $113.9 million. This compares to a net income of $2.7 million or $0.15 a share on a pro forma basis on revenue of $71.8 million for the correspondent quarter a year ago, it said.
Dane said the results reflected growth in all markets the company participates in.
